intro: Cryptantha alfalfalis, commonly known as alfalfa cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many plants capable of nitrogen fixation. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cryptantha alfalfalis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
